controls.title: Ensure DCCP is disabled
controls.description: The Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) is a transport layer protocol that supports streaming media and telephony.
controls.rationale: If the protocol is not required, it is recommended that the drivers not be installed to reduce the potential attack surface.
controls.audit:
Run the following commands and verify the output is as indicated:
# modprobe -n -v dccp
install /bin/true
# lsmod | grep dccp
Nothing should be returned
controls.remediation:
Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf
Example: vi /etc/modprobe.d/dccp.conf
and add the following line:
install dccp /bin/true

controls.title: Ensure SCTP is disabled
controls.description: The Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) is a transport layer protocol used to support message oriented communication, with several streams of messages in one connection.
controls.rationale: If the protocol is not being used, it is recommended that kernel module not be loaded, disabling the service to reduce the potential attack surface.
controls.audit:
Run the following commands and verify the output is as indicated:
# modprobe -n -v sctp
install /bin/true
# lsmod | grep sctp
Nothing should be returned
controls.remediation:
Edit or create a file in the /etc/modprobe.d/ directory ending in .conf
Example: vi /etc/modprobe.d/sctp.conf
and add the following line:
install sctp /bin/true
